intro: Neoporteria subgibbosa f. microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded neoporteria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, aromatic leaves. The inflorescence consists of umbels of tiny white to greenish-white flowers, which bloom in summer. This fern-like plant is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a desirable plant for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
